title: Alistar Ult doesn't mitigate Pyke Ult
body: This isn't a "Pyke is OP" post.. but shouldn't Alistar's Ultimate be a counter to Pyke's? It seems like Pyke just gets away with the flat damage no matter what.

replies.body:
Even if the mechanic wasn't "you die", you would still not be able to lower it with Alistar Ult.
Because it is **true** Damage. Nothing negates, lowers or changes it.

Pyke has an execute, if you're under X HP, you die

Alistar just gets a damage reduction, that doesn't increase his HP
Alistar ult doesnt negate true damage or executes.

what? why would it? 

?????????????????????????????????????
ali ult reduces physical and magic damage. pyke's ult is true damage. what? ????????????????????????????

There needs to be some counter play to that Ult. 

Shields don't shield the damage. Ask any Tahm Kench that bruises through a Pyke combo and turns the Grey Health into a shield. So Pyke gets to deal True damage that ALSO ignores shields, and can be spam-cast to dump gold on allies..

Vayne's True Damage doesn't ignore shields. 
And the "execute" function was argued to be "OP" when Urgot got his new Ult and Urgot gets 1 cast with plenty of time to escape.

Pyke and Urgot have a mechanic called "execution." When activated, it starts by dealing the target's current health in true damage. If this doesn't kill them, perhaps due to a shield, it quickly deals additional damage in an attempt to kill the target: first 10, then 100, etc., until it has dealt 1,111,110 additional true damage. If the target is still alive at that point, probably due to e.g. Kayle ult or Tryn ult, the execute gives up and stops dealing damage. Alistar's ult doesn't mitigate true damage, and it can't absorb damage equal to his current health plus at least 1,111,111 (for him to live with 1 hp), so it won't prevent his death.
Na that's the mechanic if you drop below X you get executed regardless of your defences

Pyke's ult is an execution when the enemy is below a certain low HP threshold, thus ignoring any damage reduction & shield. So in this case, Alistar's ult basically does nothing since his health was already too low.
"X just gets away with the damage no matter what."  Yeah, that's how things go now.
